column4: are you still trying to figure out how to edit your sources list?
yes i can't get it
open a terminal, gksudo gedit /path/to/file
where is the terminal?
?... you don't know where the terminal is, how long have you been using ubuntu, and what are tyou trying to edit in your sources.list?
got it!

what are you trying to edit in your sources lsit?... i question wether you know what you're doing if you didnt' know where the terminal was.., and you hose your source list... it can be a pain to get back to normal
then you're doing something wrong.
i ran the command "sudo mv /etc/apt ~"
and i can't get emacs to work because my apt-get stopped owrking
why did apt-get stop working?
i'm not sure
but i ran "sudo mv /etc/apt ~" so i could edit my sources.list....or at least that's what a forum told me
what forum told you to do that?
i would suggest rebuilding your source list
ok ill try that!
wait...sudo apt-get exits on signal 11 with some complain about "GPG keyrings not found"
fix your source list, then install whatever it is you're trying to install.
and use a bit more auction in info you find online.
will do
thanks :)
or if you want, i'll pastebin mine... makes me no difference
